oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE FIELD BEHIND THE PERMEABLE DETACHED BREAKWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ou, Shan-Hwei
Tzang, Shiaw-Yih
Hsu, Tai-Wen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave field
breakwater
detached breakwater
permeable breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Based on the concept of linear superposition, the model for combined wave refraction and diffraction developed by Liu et al. is extended to the situation of permeable detached breakwaters in a slowly varying water depth. Two cases are investigated which include a semi-infinite permeable breakwater and a single permeable breakwater. Laboratory results with a particular transmission coefficient in a wave basin are used to compare with the theoretical results. Fair agreements are found.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 8
